metadata.title: CVE-2013-2075 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple buffer overflows in the (1) R5RS char-ready, (2) tcp-accept-ready,and (3) file-select procedures in Chicken through 4.8.0.3 allows attackersto cause a denial of service (crash) by opening a file descriptor with alarge integer value. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incomplete fixfor CVE-2012-6122.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-2075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chicken-bin - 4.8.0.5-1
libchicken7 - 4.8.0.5-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chicken package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0.5-1').
